sentence.Network_en: Everybody will think that I am setting myself to captivate Mr. Boldwood.
sentence.Network_cn: 大伙儿都以为我在动脑筋给博尔德伍德先生灌迷魂汤吧.

sentence.Network_en: Mystic lakes and sparkling waterfalls captivate your eyes as you enter the ravine.
sentence.Network_cn: 当你步入沟中,便可见瀑布舒洒碧玉.

sentence.Network_en: The allure and charm of Paris captivate all who visit there.
sentence.Network_cn: 它的诱惑与魅力吸引了所有到那游玩的人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from late Latin captivat- 'taken captive', from the verb captivare, from captivus (see captive)

entry.def: If you are captivated by someone or something, you find them fascinating and attractive.

example.ex: I was captivated by her brilliant mind...
For 40 years she has captivated the world with her radiant looks.
example.tran: 40年来,她那令人惊艳的美貌让全世界为之痴迷。

auth_sentence.content: Why does a portrait of a wealthy Flemish couple captivate us so much?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why does a portrait of a wealthy Flemish couple captivate us so much?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why does a portrait of a wealthy Flemish couple captivate us so much?

auth_sentence.content: This group have created a towering work that's enough to captivate the minds of even the most desperate souls out there.
auth_sentence.res_content: This group have created a towering work that's enough to captivate the minds of even the most desperate souls out there.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This group have created a towering work that's enough to captivate the minds of even the most desperate souls out there.

auth_sentence.content: One of the most joyous releases of the decade, its blend of pop and soul seemed to captivate everyone who heard it.

stems_affixes.word_buile: capt拿,抓+ivate表动词→抓住→迷住,迷惑

sentences.cn: 她的美貌把他迷惑住了。

sentences.en: The audience was captivated by her performance.
sentences.cn: 观众们被她的表演吸引住了。
